content:
HttpClientCertificate Class

In this Article

Provides the client certificate fields issued by the client in response to the server's request for the client's identity.

Syntax

Declaration

public class HttpClientCertificate : System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • NameObjectCollectionBase
  • System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection
  • HttpClientCertificate

Remarks

If a Web browser uses the SSL3.0/PCT1 protocol (the URL begins with https:// instead of http://) to connect to a server and the server requires client certificates, the browser sends the client certificate fields contained in its digital certificate.

For more information about digital certificates, see the document X.509: Public-key and attribute certificate frameworks, available on the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) site at http://www.itu.int.

Properties summary

BinaryIssuer

Gets or sets the certificate issuer, in binary format.
CertEncoding

Gets the encoding of the certificate.
Certificate

Gets a string containing the binary stream of the entire certificate content, in ASN.1 format.
Cookie

Gets the unique ID for the client certificate, if provided.
Flags

A set of flags that provide additional client certificate information.
IsPresent

Gets a value that indicates whether the client certificate is present.
Issuer

A string that contains a list of subfield values containing information about the certificate issuer.
IsValid

Gets a value that indicates whether the client certificate is valid.
KeySize

Gets the number of bits in the digital certificate key size. For example, 128.
PublicKey

Gets the public key binary value from the certificate.
SecretKeySize

Gets the number of bits in the server certificate private key. For example, 1024.
SerialNumber

Provides the certificate serial number as an ASCII representation of hexadecimal bytes separated by hyphens. For example, 04-67-F3-02.
ServerIssuer

Gets the issuer field of the server certificate.
ServerSubject

Gets the subject field of the server certificate.
Subject

Gets the subject field of the client certificate.
ValidFrom

Gets the date when the certificate becomes valid. The date varies with international settings.
ValidUntil

Gets the certificate expiration date.

Methods summary

Get(String)

Returns individual client certificate fields by name.

Properties

  • BinaryIssuer

    Gets or sets the certificate issuer, in binary format.

    public byte[] BinaryIssuer { get; }

    Property Value

    • Byte[]

      The certificate issuer, expressed in binary format.

  • CertEncoding

    Gets the encoding of the certificate.

    public int CertEncoding { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      One of the CERT_CONTEXT.dwCertEncodingType values.

    Remarks

    For more information about the CERT_CONTEXT structure, see http://msdn.microsoft.com and search for CERT_CONTEXT.

  • Certificate

    Gets a string containing the binary stream of the entire certificate content, in ASN.1 format.

    public byte[] Certificate { get; }

    Property Value

    • Byte[]

      The client certificate.

  • Cookie

    Gets the unique ID for the client certificate, if provided.

    public string Cookie { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The client certificate ID.

    Remarks

    The Cookie can be used as a signature for the whole client certificate.

  • Flags

    A set of flags that provide additional client certificate information.

    public int Flags { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      A set of Boolean flags.

    Remarks

    Bit0 is set to 1 if the client certificate is present. Bit1 is set to 1 if the Certificate Authority (CA) of the client certificate is not in the list of recognized CAs on the server.

  • IsPresent

    Gets a value that indicates whether the client certificate is present.

    public bool IsPresent { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the client certificate is present; otherwise, false.

  • Issuer

    A string that contains a list of subfield values containing information about the certificate issuer.

    public string Issuer { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The certificate issuer's information.

  • IsValid

    Gets a value that indicates whether the client certificate is valid.

    public bool IsValid { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the client certificate is valid; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The client certificate is not valid if the Certificate Authority (CA) is not in the list of recognized CAs on the server.

  • KeySize

    Gets the number of bits in the digital certificate key size. For example, 128.

    public int KeySize { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The number of bits in the key size.

  • PublicKey

    Gets the public key binary value from the certificate.

    public byte[] PublicKey { get; }

    Property Value

    • Byte[]

      A byte array that contains the public key value.

  • SecretKeySize

    Gets the number of bits in the server certificate private key. For example, 1024.

    public int SecretKeySize { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The number of bits in the server certificate private key.

  • SerialNumber

    Provides the certificate serial number as an ASCII representation of hexadecimal bytes separated by hyphens. For example, 04-67-F3-02.

    public string SerialNumber { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The certificate serial number.

  • ServerIssuer

    Gets the issuer field of the server certificate.

    public string ServerIssuer { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The issuer field of the server certificate.

  • ServerSubject

    Gets the subject field of the server certificate.

    public string ServerSubject { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The subject field of the server certificate.

  • Subject

    Gets the subject field of the client certificate.

    public string Subject { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The subject field of the client certificate.

    Remarks

    If String is specified without a subfield, the HttpClientCertificate collection returns a comma-separated list of subfields. For example, C=US, O= Msft.

  • ValidFrom

    Gets the date when the certificate becomes valid. The date varies with international settings.

    public DateTime ValidFrom { get; }

    Property Value

    • DateTime

      The date when the certificate becomes valid.

  • ValidUntil

    Gets the certificate expiration date.

    public DateTime ValidUntil { get; }

    Property Value

    • DateTime

      The certificate expiration date.

    Remarks

    The year value is displayed as a four-digit number.

Methods

  • Get(String)

    Returns individual client certificate fields by name.

    public override string Get (string field);

    Parameters

    • field
      String

      The item in the collection to retrieve.

    Returns

    • String

      The value of the item specified by field.
